column4: Control_Desc
The Company maintains a physical security standard which contains requirements for physical controls.
The Company performs Physical Security Assessments for all facilities on a [INSERT TIME FRAME] basis.
The Company performs Physical Penetration Tests for [INSERT TIER LEVEL] facilities on a [INSERT TIME FRAME] basis.
Electronic Access Control Systems (ACS) are used to secure [INSERT TIER LEVEL] facilities.
The Company supervisors approve physical access requests before physical access is granted.
Physical Access reviews are performed in accordance with the Access Management Team Review Process.
Physical badge access is deprovisioned within [INSERT TIME FRAME] of notification of termination of an employee or contractor.
Visitors at all [INSERT TIER LEVEL] facilities are required to sign-in on an approved visitor log or register in an electronic visitor management system.
The Company uses video surveillance systems at [INSERT TIER LEVEL] facilities.
The Company has designed and implemented environmental controls to protect information systems at all [INSERT TIER LEVEL] facilities.
The Company maintains a comprehensive business continuity and disaster recovery framework that is reviewed and approved by relevant company management on a [INSERT TIME FRAME] basis.
The Company executes contingency plans, including business continuity and disaster recovery, during or after an event as deemed necessary for plan activation.

The Company updates contingency plans on a [INSERT TIME FRAME] basis, as a result of an incident/event, or based on the results of a contingency plan test. The Company incorporates lessons learned and updates strategies, as necessary.
The Company tests contingency plans on a [INSERT TIME FRAME] basis.
The Company uses alternate sites to permit the transfer and resumption of critical information systems and processes when the primary site capabilities are unavailable.
The Company completes secure backups of information systems and data.
The Company performs testing of the integrity of backups on select applications on a [INSERT TIME FRAME] basis.
The Company maintains an inventory of Assets.
Hardware Technology Assets must be requested and approved.
Assets are securely disposed of, if no longer required.
Media is securely sanitized prior to disposal, release, or re-use.
Scope for regulatory compliance requirements is identified and documented.
The Company tracks and reports on End Of Service Life ("EOSL") for hardware and software.
The asset inventory is validated and updated on a [INSERT TIME FRAME] basis.

For The Company systems deployed in its FedRAMP boundaries, automated mechanisms to scan for, detect, and remediate the presence of unauthorized hardware, software, and firmware components are implemented.
Scope for The Company's authorization boundaries is identified and documented.
